alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 1:47PM PST until December 09 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON THURSDAY TO NOON PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches in valleys below 3000 feet, and 4 to 6 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Northport, Newport, Sandpoint, Eastport, Chewelah, Colville, Orin-Rice Road, Springdale-Hunters Road, Deer Park, Kettle Falls, Athol, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Flowery Trail Road. * WHEN...From Noon Thursday to Noon PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. Heaviest snowfall expected during the Thursday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
